radiographic_examinations.findings: Mild obstructive sleep apnea (OSA) with significant upper airway resistance syndrome (UARS), mild periodic limb movements of sleep (PLMS) at 7/hour, and generalized spike-wave discharges in non-REM sleep and in wakefulness.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Follow-up PSG showed resolution of the OSA, improved sleep efficiency, and reduced snoring and arousal index.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Showed sleep onset REM (SOREM) in 2 of the 5 naps and a normal sleep latency of 18 minutes.
Frequent 1- to 4-second bursts of 4 Hz, irregular generalized spike/polyspike and slow wave complexes potentiated by hyperventilation and associated with subtle clinical seizures.
